creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
inscription:
Poem
When the wind comes from ocean to the Tamagawa river in Mutsu province in evening, plovers cry flying over the river. 
Japanese: u_sareba shiokaze ??? michinoku no noda no tamagawa chidori naku nari
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e), ink and color on paper
portfolio: Six Jewel Rivers in Old Poems (Koka Mu Tamagawa 古歌六玉川)
title: Noda [Jewel River] in Mutsu Province
